kdl.prox.model2.rpt.modules.pruning
Class CrossValidationSelection

java.lang.Object
  kdl.prox.model2.rpt.modules.pruning.CrossValidationSelection
All Implemented Interfaces:
TreeSelectionModule
public class CrossValidationSelection
extends java.lang.Object
implements TreeSelectionModule

Cross-validation Tree selection for pruning involves learning trees on cross-validation samples. This implementation assumes the currentState.trainContainer has train and test samples nested within it. This procedure is very intensive. It requires learning an additional tree on each fold using the same settings as the parent rpt. A pruning sequence for each fold is also created. To select a tree from the main pruning sequence, the tree from each fold with the closest alpha value is used to estimate the error on the test set for each fold.

See Breiman, Friedman, Olshen and Stone section 3.4.2 for more details.

getBestFoldTree

public RPTNode getBestFoldTree(java.util.List<PruningRPTNode> pruningRPTNodes,
                               double targetAlpha)
Since the alphas may not match up between the main tree and folds. Need to find the best fold tree for the main tree alpha. This is the first tree with alpha >= target alpha

Parameters:
pruningRPTNodes -
targetAlpha -
Returns:
